item.title: ASUS Eee PC 1005HA
item.description: The ASUS Eee PC 1005HA, a.k.a Seashell, is a 10.1 inch netbook powered by an 1.6 GHz Intel Atom N270 Processor. It is equipped with 1 GB DDR2 RAM, a 160 GB hard drive.

item.title: ASUS Eee PC 701SD
item.description: The ASUS Eee PC 701SD is one of the early models of the Eee PC series that is offered with the Xandros Linux operating system.

item.title: First Look at Pegatron's Freescale-based Netbook
item.description: Sascha reports from Freescale headquarters in Taipei, taking a first look at the Pegatron netbook, a very thin and light laptop with an estimated weight of 800

item.title: ASUS Eee PC 1000HD
item.description: The ASUS Eee PC 1000HD is one of the larger models of the Eee series with a 10 inch backlit LED display powered by a 900 MHz Intel Celeron M 353 processor.

item.title: Playing Final Fantasy on the ASUS Eee PC
item.description: This video by khanh demonstrates Final Fantasy VII being played on a basic ASUS Eee PC 701 running Xandros Linux without CPU overclocking or hardware upgrades.

item.title: ASUS Eee PC 4G
item.description: With dimensions of 8.9 x 6.3 x 1.3 inches and a weight of merely 2 lb (0.92 kg) the ASUS Eee PC 4G is one of the smallest netbooks available.

item.title: ASUS Eee PC 2G Surf
item.description: The ASUS Eee PC 2G Surf certainly deserves to be called an ultraportable laptop with a weight of just 2.03 lbs.

item.title: Xandros vs WinXP on ASUS Eee PC 900
item.description: In the video two ASUS Eee PC 900 netbooks are first booted, then Firefox is launched, and finally they are shutdown. One has been running Xandros Linux and the

item.title: ASUS 8.9-inch Eee PC 4G
item.description: The 8.9-inch Eee 4G from ASUS is a highly portable and affordable netbook for everyone who wants to run net-centric applications on the move.

item.title: ASUS Eee PC 1000
item.description: The ASUS Eee PC 1000 is currently the largest and most powerful of ASUS' Eee PC netbook series.
